passages.text: Nobody is smart enough to be wrong all the time.
passages.context: Everyone has a piece of the truth

passages.text: The Witness is not something you can see. It is what is looking.
Transcend and include: each stage of development goes beyond and yet embraces its predecessors.
The pre/trans fallacy occurs when we confuse prerational states with transrational ones—infantile fusion with genuine mystical union.
An integral approach includes all the major methodologies—phenomenology, empiricism, hermeneutics, systems theory—because each discloses a different dimension of reality.
You can't get a view from nowhere. But you can get an integral view that includes the view from everywhere.
The whole point of an integral approach is: everybody is right. Every approach has some truth to offer. The question is, how do we fit them all together?
States are temporary, structures are enduring. You can have a peak experience of nondual awareness, but you interpret it through your current stage of development.
The deeper you go within, the wider you embrace without. Interior depth and exterior span grow together.
Spirit is not some separate thing but the very texture of each and every thing.
All knowing is perspectival. But some perspectives are more encompassing than others. That's what development means.
You don't transcend your ego by attacking it. You transcend it by making it transparent—seeing through it while still being able to use it.
The Self is not something you find at the end of the journey. The Self is what is looking at the journey.
Green meme pluralism says all perspectives are equal. Integral says all perspectives are true—but partial. There's a big difference.
Evolution is spirit-in-action. It is a trillion years of cosmic creativity, still unfolding.
The four quadrants: interior individual (I), exterior individual (It), interior collective (We), exterior collective (Its). All four are irreducible.
Most arguments are not really disagreements about facts. They are disagreements about which quadrant or level is most important.
Waking up (states of consciousness) and growing up (stages of development) are different but both essential. You can have one without the other.
What appears as matter on the outside appears as mind on the inside. They are two sides of the same thing.
The ultimate reality is not difficult to understand. It is impossible to avoid. You are already aware. You are already enlightened. You just don't notice.
